author: TravisEz13
body:
<!--

If you are running a released version of powershell, but not the latest one, install the latest from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases and try to repro it again

Before submitting this issue, please first:

- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- [X] If it is a bug, fill out this form:
-->
## Steps to reproduce

10.123.172.176]: PS C:\Users\LocalAdmin\Documents> Set-TimeZone -id 'Pacific Standard Time'
## Expected behavior

Sets the timezone
## Actual behavior

Unable to load DLL 'api-ms-win-downlevel-kernel32-l1.dll': The specified module could not be found. (Exception from
HRESULT: 0x8007007E)
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Set-TimeZone], DllNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.DllNotFoundException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.SetTimeZoneCommand
## Environment data

Running on nano using script from nano team

<!-- If running the latest released version, specify the version, i.e. -->

v0.4.0

<!-- If running you own build, please fill in the results of the following commands: -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSVersion                      5.1.14361.1000
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSEdition                      Core
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
CLRVersion
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
BuildVersion                   10.0.14361.1000
```

``` sh
$ dotnet --info
.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.0-preview2-003096)

Product Information:
 Version:            1.0.0-preview2-003096
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  191812690d

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.14353
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64

$ git rev-parse HEAD; git status
D:\git\PowerShell [master ≡ +2 ~0 -3 !]> git rev-parse HEAD; git status
ebd28ec6651347e11a4efef492817565e6c6b49d
On branch master
Your branch is up-to-date with 'PowerShell/master'.
nothing to commit, working directory clean

```

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This is not how setting the timezone on Linux works. We should probably make this throw a platform unsupported exception.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Per @daxian-dbw timezone.cs is missing in Management.dll

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
The PR #1285 add the TimeZone cmdlets back to OSPS @TravisEz13 
However, the TimeZone cmdlets are excluded for Linux build.

title: Set-TimeZone is missing
